Teaching Assistant

University of Virginia

Instructing two core CS courses: Computer Systems and Organizations 1 & 2 with 600 & 450 students respectively. Topics range from circuits, assembly, C, system architecture, virtual memory, caches, processes, threads, networking, page tables, etc. Leading lab-sessions of 150 students, evaluating student assignments, contributing to the development of new course materials, as well as holding one-on-one office hour sessions 3 hours a week to further drive student understanding and engagement.

University of Virginia

Performed literature reviews of 3-5 publications per week, analyzing and self-teaching complex concepts outlined in research papers, and holding weekly meetings with the professor to discuss the implementation of said topics into new proposals for Oblivious Algorithms.

Led the product presentation to a group of 50 other interns and 10 staff.
